title: Verify that we are able to sucessfully upload the file when Merge Sale rep is True
custom_steps:
1. Launch the Patron Merge Tool link
Expected Result:
The URL should connected successfully
2. Login the Application with Ping API using supplied credentials
Expected Result:
The log in page for the application should be displayed
3. Select file should be uploaded sucessfully 
and the current rules defined for this 
functionality should be evaluated by PV to 
identify the sales rep that will be merger and 
retained
Expected Result:
User uploaded the file successfully

custom_steps_separated.content:
1. Launch the Patron Merge Tool link
2. Login the Application with Ping API using supplied credentials
3. Select file should be uploaded sucessfully 
and the current rules defined for this 
functionality should be evaluated by PV to 
identify the sales rep that will be merger and 
retained
custom_steps_separated.expected:
1. The URL should connected successfully
2. The log in page for the application should be displayed
3. User uploaded the file successfully

title: Verify whether price points are updated when price point ID, buyer type  and price scale  are correctly provided in the import file
custom_steps:
1. Prerequisite
1. User should have access to Price Change Utility
2. A text file containing the price changes being requested should be available with no 
price point ID and  buyer type and price scale and change location as PROVENUE
2. Launch Price Change Utility : 
https://irqainfutil1.back.tickets.com/PriceChangeSyncApplication/Connections/PVQAF1
Expected Result:
Price change Utility should be launched
3. Enter valid TDC account/ Password
Expected Result:
Valid Credentials should be entered
4. Click login button
Expected Result:
Application landing page should be displayed
5. Click the button for browsing file and select the file 
specified in prerequisite
Expected Result:
File to be imported should be selected and the 
path should be displayed in the Price change 
utility
6. Click on import option
Expected Result:
File should be imported and header values should 
be displayed tab delimited
7. Click on Submit Price Changes button
Expected Result:
Price changes should be submitted
8. Verify whether price points are updated when price point ID, buyer type  and price scale  are correctly provided in the 
import file
Expected Result:
Price points should be updated successfully

custom_steps_separated.content:
1. Prerequisite
1. User should have access to Price Change Utility
2. A text file containing the price changes being requested should be available with no 
price point ID and  buyer type and price scale and change location as PROVENUE
2. Launch Price Change Utility : 
https://irqainfutil1.back.tickets.com/PriceChangeSyncApplication/Connections/PVQAF1
3. Enter valid TDC account/ Password
4. Click login button
5. Click the button for browsing file and select the file 
specified in prerequisite
6. Click on import option
7. Click on Submit Price Changes button
8. Verify whether price points are updated when price point ID, buyer type  and price scale  are correctly provided in the 
import file
custom_steps_separated.expected:
1. 
2. Price change Utility should be launched
3. Valid Credentials should be entered
4. Application landing page should be displayed
5. File to be imported should be selected and the 
path should be displayed in the Price change 
utility
6. File should be imported and header values should 
be displayed tab delimited
7. Price changes should be submitted
8. Price points should be updated successfully

title: Verify user is able to complete redelivery with Single Cad Per Seat
custom_preconds: Complete sale transactions for a patron for single list package
custom_steps:
1. 1. Login to Redelivery tool
2. Select Card Per Seat option from main menu
3. Enter valid Account ID with more than 1000 setas and click SEARCH
4. Select less than 1000 tickets
5. Click on REDELIVER button
6. Select all Required Fields and Continue On Error=Yes/No
7. Click Proceed button
8. Check Acknowledge checkbox
9. Click Proceed
Expected Result:
Redelivery should be successful
2. Download output file

custom_steps_separated.content:
1. 1. Login to Redelivery tool
2. Select Card Per Seat option from main menu
3. Enter valid Account ID with more than 1000 setas and click SEARCH
4. Select less than 1000 tickets
5. Click on REDELIVER button
6. Select all Required Fields and Continue On Error=Yes/No
7. Click Proceed button
8. Check Acknowledge checkbox
9. Click Proceed
2. Download output file
custom_steps_separated.expected:
1. Redelivery should be successful
2.

title: Verify the Processing is not getting stopped during standard redelivery when input file contains invalid records and Continue On Error is Yes.
custom_preconds:
Complete a sale transaction in PV
Create an input file with multiple rows
Make sure some of the record having invalid value
custom_steps:
1. Log into Redelivery Tool
Expected Result:
User should able to log into Redelivery successfully
2. Upload the input file which is provided in pre-condition
Expected Result:
Input file should be uploaded  successfully
3. Select the Agency and Continue on error option-YES
Expected Result:
Both should be selected
4. Click on the submit button
Expected Result:
Clicked on the submit button
5. Verify the Processing is not getting stopped during standard re delivery when input file contains invalid records and Continue On Error is Yes.
Expected Result:
Success

custom_steps_separated.content:
1. Log into Redelivery Tool
2. Upload the input file which is provided in pre-condition
3. Select the Agency and Continue on error option-YES
4. Click on the submit button
5. Verify the Processing is not getting stopped during standard re delivery when input file contains invalid records and Continue On Error is Yes.
custom_steps_separated.expected:
1. User should able to log into Redelivery successfully
2. Input file should be uploaded  successfully
3. Both should be selected
4. Clicked on the submit button
5. Success

title: Verify whether 'Unused Ticket Voucher Utility' processed successfully if required fields are provided
custom_preconds:
1.Launch PV
2.Create a user which have external agency
3.Complete sale transaction for source event
custom_steps:
1. Launch "Unused Ticket Voucher Utility" tool by providing valid URL 
Expected Result:
User is able to launch "Unused Ticket Voucher Utility" tool 
2. Login to the tool by providing valid credential
Expected Result:
User should be able to login successfully
3. Click on Validate fields button with entering below required fields 
ï‚§ Source Event Code (uppercase, alphanumeric)
ï‚§ Patron Trait ID (integer)
ï‚§ Voucher Event Code (uppercase, alphanumeric)
ï‚§ Voucher Buyer Type Code (uppercase, alphanumeric)- Provide zero balance buyer type like Adult
ï‚§ Voucher Price Scale Code (uppercase, alphanumeric)
ï‚§ Target order Delivery Method Code (uppercase, alphanumeric)

-click on validate fields button 
Expected Result:
User navigate to Validation Summary Report
4. click on Proceed button
Expected Result:
Process should completed successfully
5. Verify Output file in Response summary & Download Logs
Expected Result:
File should contain required fields

custom_steps_separated.content:
1. Launch "Unused Ticket Voucher Utility" tool by providing valid URL 
2. Login to the tool by providing valid credential
3. Click on Validate fields button with entering below required fields 
ï‚§ Source Event Code (uppercase, alphanumeric)
ï‚§ Patron Trait ID (integer)
ï‚§ Voucher Event Code (uppercase, alphanumeric)
ï‚§ Voucher Buyer Type Code (uppercase, alphanumeric)- Provide zero balance buyer type like Adult
ï‚§ Voucher Price Scale Code (uppercase, alphanumeric)
ï‚§ Target order Delivery Method Code (uppercase, alphanumeric)

-click on validate fields button 
4. click on Proceed button
5. Verify Output file in Response summary & Download Logs
custom_steps_separated.expected:
1. User is able to launch "Unused Ticket Voucher Utility" tool 
2. User should be able to login successfully
3. User navigate to Validation Summary Report
4. Process should completed successfully
5. File should contain required fields

title: Verify whether the orders are sent to Salesforce when INDIANS supplier event is placed with patron having INDCODE access code
custom_preconds:
Create an Indian supplier Event
Create a patron using INDCODE  
Perform transaction for the event using the patron
custom_steps:
1. Launch PVF link
https://qa02-tdc-pvf-dev-ed.lightning.force.com
Expected Result:
Success
2. Login with valid credentials
Expected Result:
Success
3. Go to Accounts and search for the patron id
Expected Result:
Patron Details page should be displayed.
4. Verify whether the order details and order product details are displayed in ProvenueForce
Expected Result:
Order details and order product details are displayed in ProvenueForce
5. Verify the PVHC-Salesforce logs
Expected Result:
Order details should be passed correctly without any errors

custom_steps_separated.content:
1. Launch PVF link
https://qa02-tdc-pvf-dev-ed.lightning.force.com
2. Login with valid credentials
3. Go to Accounts and search for the patron id
4. Verify whether the order details and order product details are displayed in ProvenueForce
5. Verify the PVHC-Salesforce logs
custom_steps_separated.expected:
1. Success
2. Success
3. Patron Details page should be displayed.
4. Order details and order product details are displayed in ProvenueForce
5. Order details should be passed correctly without any errors

title: Verify in SF after merging two patron accounts
custom_preconds:
Create a source account and target patron account in PV
Create a input file with Merge Contacts Option as  ALL
custom_steps:
1. Launch the Patron Merge Tool link with Valid Credentials


Expected Result:
User should be able to login to tool
2. Select the input file click on submit patron merge file button

Expected Result:
Patron Merge should be completed
3. Verify Merged account's in  SF
Expected Result:
All Source account details should be merged into target account.

custom_steps_separated.content:
1. Launch the Patron Merge Tool link with Valid Credentials


2. Select the input file click on submit patron merge file button

3. Verify Merged account's in  SF
custom_steps_separated.expected:
1. User should be able to login to tool
2. Patron Merge should be completed
3. All Source account details should be merged into target account.

title: Verify PVF supports PV accounts
custom_steps:
1. Login to PVNG using valid credentials

Expected Result:
User should be able to login to the application
2. Create an Account, create an event and complete a transaction and note the order
Expected Result:
Account and event created.
Transaction completed successfully.
3. Login to PVF 2.0 with valid credetnails
Expected Result:
Login should be successful
4. Verify the account details field  are updated in accounts tab.
Expected Result:
Account details are updated in accounts tab.
5. Verify order details are updated in order tab
Expected Result:
Order details are updated in order tab.

custom_steps_separated.content:
1. Login to PVNG using valid credentials

2. Create an Account, create an event and complete a transaction and note the order
3. Login to PVF 2.0 with valid credetnails
4. Verify the account details field  are updated in accounts tab.
5. Verify order details are updated in order tab
custom_steps_separated.expected:
1. User should be able to login to the application
2. Account and event created.
Transaction completed successfully.
3. Login should be successful
4. Account details are updated in accounts tab.
5. Order details are updated in order tab.

title: Verify sync in crowdconnect for Form Opt-In/Opt-Out
custom_preconds: Create DPU and associate to the corresponding ORG from PV
custom_steps:
1. Log into CrowdConnect and Navigate to list
Expected Result:
Success
2. Update subscriber list to Opt-In/Opt-Out in crowdconnect 
Expected Result:
user should able to update
3. Check sync is happening
Expected Result:
Patron Accounts with a matching primary email address should create/update the Data Protection Setting Appropriately.

custom_steps_separated.content:
1. Log into CrowdConnect and Navigate to list
2. Update subscriber list to Opt-In/Opt-Out in crowdconnect 
3. Check sync is happening
custom_steps_separated.expected:
1. Success
2. user should able to update
3. Patron Accounts with a matching primary email address should create/update the Data Protection Setting Appropriately.

title: Verify subscriber Upsert file is upserted to whatscount
custom_preconds:
1. email.marketing.features.enabled = true
2. Account mapped to in scope org
custom_steps:
1. Go to Organization Admin > Search for the Owning Organization (Org1) > check if Marketing Domain entity is displayed 
Expected Result:
'Marketing Domain entity should be displayed in Org1
2. Run PVEM/CrowdConnect extract process for a particular client/marketing domain 
Expected Result:
PVEM upsert file is reformated to the FTP Command file to upsert the WhatCounts subscriber table.

custom_steps_separated.content:
1. Go to Organization Admin > Search for the Owning Organization (Org1) > check if Marketing Domain entity is displayed 
2. Run PVEM/CrowdConnect extract process for a particular client/marketing domain
custom_steps_separated.expected:
1. 'Marketing Domain entity should be displayed in Org1
2. PVEM upsert file is reformated to the FTP Command file to upsert the WhatCounts subscriber table.

title: Verify the seat details are getting displayed in single row when Source Patron Account merged into Target Patron Account
custom_steps:
1. Log into PV
Expected Result:
Success
2. Create Source Patron Account and Target Patron Account
Expected Result:
Success
3. Merge the source into target patron account
Expected Result:
Source should be removed and target should be updated along with source patron account
4. Run the workflow
Expected Result:
Success
5. Verify the output file
Expected Result:
The seat details are should be displayed with single row
6. Log into whats count
Expected Result:
Success
7. Verify the Patron Account Relational table
Expected Result:
The seat details are should be displayed with single row in exported file

custom_steps_separated.content:
1. Log into PV
2. Create Source Patron Account and Target Patron Account
3. Merge the source into target patron account
4. Run the workflow
5. Verify the output file
6. Log into whats count
7. Verify the Patron Account Relational table
custom_steps_separated.expected:
1. Success
2. Success
3. Source should be removed and target should be updated along with source patron account
4. Success
5. The seat details are should be displayed with single row
6. Success
7. The seat details are should be displayed with single row in exported file
